div.p: Unit 3, VPRS 780 inward correspondence, Melbourne Observatory, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Kay passed M's letter on to Professor William Wilson, also of the Board of Visitors, with the recommendation: 'This is worth considering. If the pipes are to be brought as far as the Military Barracks I think we might put in a claim for extension to the Observy as a necessity of the observatory & as aiding in bringing the supply to the Botanical Gardens. Qu'en pensez vous?' [What do you think?].
See also M to W. Wilson, 20 August 1862. 29/7/62

It appears, that a 3" pipe of the Yan Yean Aquaeduct is to be forthwith extended to the New Military Barracks. I would solicit your kind interest & that of the other members of the Observatory Board for the purpose of obtaining an extension of the pipe to your observatory ground, where I presume water for safety's sake will be required and whence it would by the influence of the Board
be omitted. easily obtained. If you could bring the pipes thus far, I could find this year means already in my department to extend the waterwork to the botanic Garden.
